Name: J. Robert
Description: American physicist known as the 'father of the atomic bomb' for leading the Manhattan Project. He later directed the Institute for Advanced Study and advocated for peaceful nuclear use.

Name: Albert
Description: German-born theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity and explained the photoelectric effect. Nobel laureate and advocate for peace and civil rights.

Name: Marie
Description: Polish-born scientist who discovered polonium and radium. First person to win Nobel Prizes in two sciences and pioneer of research on radioactivity.

Name: Nikola
Description: Serbian-American inventor and engineer who developed alternating current systems and contributed to wireless communication and electric motors.

Name: Isaac
Description: English scientist who formulated the laws of motion and gravity, co-developed calculus, and revolutionized physics and mathematics.
